title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: This interview was for a position at the THR Alliance location. The process was not great from the beginning. I applied within the first week of October 2022. After over two weeks, I hadn't heard from the recruiting team, so I reached out for a follow up. Finally, in early November 2022, I received a request for a phone screening. To their credit, they did get this scheduled within 24 hours, but that was the only good part about the process. After the phone screening, I did not hear back from the TA consultant/team, and I had followed up twice to determine the status of my application. Finally, in early December 2022, I received the "thanks but no thanks" email. A recruiting process that takes two months does not seem very efficient to me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you saw a problem and took the initiative to fix it.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: People are writing during the peer interviews the entire time, state they don’t care for the boring questions, unprofessional overall. Manager was missing on arrival for first interview, couldn’t be found. Had difficulty getting leader to shake my hand, felt like I was just a number, and that they were going through the motions not really giving a candidate a chance. They act like it’s getting into Harvard, but have agency personnel in the panel interviews. I probably wouldn’t accept, but it’s good to know what’s out there so I can appreciate the position I already have. It’s a shame that nurses are being degraded like this in the job market. Also, management asked personal questions about death in the family 6 years ago, and confirmed interview for the next day at 9 pm the night before, where I had to end up canceling part of my plans. They had my availability a week prior. Did not acknowledge any of my talent, credentials and promotions; only interested in unveiling potential character flaws and I would gladly have shared my weaknesses if asked. Manager admitted not to be on top of things. Very insincere and disingenuous. They also like texting, anytime of day.
Interview Questions: What is a difficult problem you have brought to management in the past?

title: Patient Account Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (New York, NY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Applied back on June 8th. Received a request from HR to do a Prescreen, which is just a form they email to you asking you about why you are looking for a job and why you're interested in that specific position, how much experience you have, your pay rate expectation, etc. on July 21. Received a call from the hiring manager on August 9th and scheduled interview for August 13th. Meet with an older African american women and an older Caucasian women. They stated that they were 2 separate departments that both had an opening. Interview was expected to be about 30 minutes but ours lasted about an hour. Both ladies were really kind and seemed to be honest about the questions that I asked. They both seemed as though they would be really cool to work for but also that they expected you to be serious and work hard. We ended the interview with that I was there last interview and they would get together and make a decision soon. It is now August 18th and I have not heard anything yet but I have been checking my submission status and it still says Interview so I'm optimistic as I feel the interview went really well and I was very prepared with questions to ask and brought my most recent evaluation from my current supervisor and my attendance record. They asked typical behavioral questions...STARR method.  

***I recieved an email from one of the ladies I interviewed with on Monday August 19th asking if I was still interested and to call her. I called her and she offered me the position and said I should hear later that day from HR because the position she offered wasn't on the website and we had to see what HR needed to do. I heard from HR later that day and he said allow 2-4 business days to get everything together.  I recieved a verbal offer from HR on Friday August 23rd. I accepted and then recieved my offer letter. I tried to negotiate on the pay to no avail but the offer was decent, would've liked a little more but I'm satisfied. ***
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you didnt agree with a policy or procedure? And what did you do about it?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Allen, TX) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a lengthy process, but very worth while! Everyone I came into contact with was helpful, professional and very kind. All indicators of a great team, and work environment in my book. Looking forward to being a part of it!
Interview Questions: I answered a series of behavioral questions via online, prior to interview, which was great! The actual interviewer was very personable, genuine, and warm. Interview itself was more behavioral question based than situational.

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: Short, possibly because I was a current employee. My employment was a detriment. They said “This won’t be a standard interview because we already know you.” And when they offered the position to someone else, they said it was because she answered more of the technical questions. Of which I was never asked.
Interview Questions: Standard questions. What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Clinical Documentation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from the recruiter quickly after I applied online. We had agreed on a date and time for a phone interview, however, when the time came, I was never contacted. I made several attempts to reschedule or get an update on the position but received no response.
Interview Questions: I did not get a chance to interview since the phone call never happened.

title: IT Project Management Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the people who work in the department. They are looking for a culture fit in their department. Bring your resume and cover letter to help them know you better.
Interview Questions: Start with tell me about yourself. Prepare for being asked behavioral interview questions. Show passion and willingness to go beyond the requirements.

title: Admissions Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Stephenville, TX) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was the best experience I've ever had. It took about a month before HR contacted me and the manager set up an interview. The interview itself took about 15 minutes; I was expecting a variety of interview questions, but none of them were asked. It was incredible laid back and my interviewer was very easy to talk to. I was given an explanation about the position and salary and possible benefits that I could have. Although the interview was very short it wasn't a bad thing at all, the interviewer seemed very interested in hiring me for this position. At the end I was told I would know the final decision at the end of the week. After not hearing anything after 2 weeks I decided to call my interviewer, I was given her personal phone number, and check on the status of the position. 
Overall very positive experience!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the research position on their website. I was told they would like to continue with my application but I did not get it past that stage. They were very fast in responding to all my applications.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: My floor manager and nurses that interviewed me were really nice and made it feel really comfortable. They asked typical nursing questions like behavioral questions and also questions about my resume.
Interview Questions: Behavioral nursing questions (tell me a time...)

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (New York, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was given a few different scenarios with a difficult or upset patient and I had to tell her how I would have handled the situation and why. She also asked for a personal experience when I was upset and how they handled it
Interview Questions: I was given a few different scenarios with a difficult or upset patient and I had to tell her how I would have handled the situation

title: Patient Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was less than 2 week. It was really long interview and asked a lot of questions. They used STAR method questions, scenario questions and asked a lot of experience questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you learned something and how were you receptive to the feedback

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Burleson, TX) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening took about ten minutes. They ran through basic personality questions to get to know a little bit of my background.  Interview was short. And seemed very positive. I just didn’t  make it past the phone interview to get the in person interview. They went in a different direction.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in respiratory therapy?

title: Applications Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: The process was okay. I applied for a position was contacted by two HR reps, then had a phone interview with the manager. I was told a recruiter would contact me but i never got a call or email. It would help if someone followed back up even if you decide not to go with the candidate. Pretty discouraging.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for THR?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: Long and drawn out. It took forever for a call back to set up interview. Staff was nice enough just took too long for contact. Routine interview questions were asked.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Behavioral Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Bedford, TX) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and had a network contact.  I met with the Clinical Director and therapists that were part of the program.  It was a very warm experience.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with a  multidisciplinary treatment team?

title: Graduate Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Since I was out of state, I had a phone interview. It differed, but it was the same overall questions asking about yourself, why this position, personality questions, an overview of the company, overview of the unit and etc.
Interview Questions:
Q. Tell me about yourself?
Q. How would you manage cost effectiveness?
Q. Tell me about a time where you used cost effectiveness during your clinical rotation?
Q. What is your role in a team?
Q. Characteristics that you would describe yourself?

title: Mental Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Great experience overall  and very friendly. The interview process was a positive experience and the nurse manager made me feel very comfortable throughout the interview. Interview questions gave me the opportunity to express who I am and how hard I work.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Took 4 weeks for  the entire process. I was reached out by a recruiter. After the initial phone screening,had a phone interview with the hiring manager and then a in person panel interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Quality Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: The process involved solely emails with a personality quiz.  The quiz did not provide information about job related situations, but asked about personal life...how do you pack traveling suitcases in a car, how often do you drive your children to school....etc.
Interview Questions: If the answers to these odd questions aren't what THR is expecting, you'll never have the opportunity to interview.  Very strange process.

title: Timekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied  online, online assessment, contacted by recruiter to schedule interview with hiring manager, and submitted references. Scheduled the interview for a week after being contacted. The process moved along pretty quickly.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself, in your career, in 5 years?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed. I met with 5 groups - 22 people total.  Everyone was very nice but asked specific questions. Panel interview with Behavior questions/peer interview.  4 hours long
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and within a week or so received email regarding phone screen. Passed phone screen and soon after scheduled a f2f interview the following week. Interview quick and simple. Position was offered and was set to start once cleared from Employee Health. Some members in the employee health and HR office were not understanding and came off rude so after that turned position down
Interview Questions: What medical background do you have

title: Student Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Before the face-to-face interview, I spoke to multiple people on the phone answering basic questions and validating information. Getting to the room the interview was being held was nearly impossible. By the time I finally arrived, I was stressed out and in shambles from being lost and trying to make the interview time. Once I arrived, I was somewhat surprised to walk into a room of about 10 people. The interview itself wasn't very difficult, but the stress of locating the meeting room threw me off.
Interview Questions: What was a conflict that you encountered during one of your clinicals? How did you respond, and why?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It use to be short and to the point.  Very open. I had to reapply for my position which I was removed from without an interview or application process
Interview Questions: It was more questions about teamwork and management.  It was more of a personality questionaire.

title: Paramedic In ER Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The Recruiter was not entirely truthful on multiple points, Interviewing Manager at the time was great and somewhat up front but held back on other behind closed door things.
Interview Questions: Why You?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel consisting of team and managers. The interview took place in the patient support center which was a nice private area to interview. The managers made you feel welcomed and were very friendly and encouraging when interviewing.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had a conflict with a coworker

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview with 2 people, DON and a manager. They were super nice, and pleasant. It was more like a personality interview. They made me feel calm and respected my thoughts. First interview in a long time that I felt like I belonged.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a co-worker that was not doing something correct

title: Resource RN ICU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied and then next day received a call for an interview. Interviewed 2 days later. Great interview process, easy and informative. Very comfortable. Interviewed with the manager and the supervisor.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a conflict; how did you handle it and what was the resolution?

title: Medica Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Plano, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant, interviewer was calming. They were not overbearing, but did ask the typical questions. They asked the traditional give me your strengths and weaknesses. I first did a phone screening but was then called in for a one on one interview.
Interview Questions: What are my weaknesses

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: Kinda nerve racking with 3 people asking you lengthy questions but wasnt awful. They were friendly.  And they were also expressionate which showed what they think of you.  They said the process of hiring is lengthy about 2 months and nit to get discouraged if you feel its not fast enough.
Interview Questions: What was a time you wished you couldve improved in your job and what was the situation and result?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Plano, TX) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions:
It was pleasant but pretty one sided. I was the only one asking questions despite both of them having my resume in front of them.

It took several weeks for them to get back to me, again I was the one following up and through. I was not impressed with my interview/hiring process. It was disjointed.
Interview Questions: There were none to speak of

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed with the hiring manager one day, and then, there were 2 panel interviews after the main interview.

It's the hiring managers decision, but I believe they are required to interview 3 candidates.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you had to deliver bad news to a group.

title: Outpatient Surgery Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Euless, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Apply online.  Called me for face to face interview.  Spoke with unit manager and assistant manager.  Within a week they called me with a job offer.  Before I left the job they had changed to panel interviews as well as with the manager.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone screen with recruiter. Another recruiter contacted me via email. Hiring managers at two locations wanted to interview me. After the first interview, I knew I wanted to work there so canceled second interview. Very laid back but professional. Met with unit manager, a PCT and RN. Interested in knowing the "why" behind what I do and made the importance of good team chemistry known. I shared some of my concerns based on former employment. Overall, a very welcoming interview and I left knowing where I stood with employer before I left. Was told I would be getting an offer and am waiting for those details.
Interview Questions: What are my goals as a PCT and health care provider?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was somewhat lengthy.  I applied online and after online application had to take an online test that took about 30 minutes.  After that, I was contact via email and was sent to a word document to complete. It consisted of questions such as :  explain any gaps in employment, etc.  This was fairly standard.  I was then contacted to set up an interview with the hiring manager.  I was offered the job that evening.  However, it was another 3 weeks before I started orientation due to their background taking so long.  For the most part it was a straight forward and painless process.  The drug screen was done at their facility which was really nice as it saved time from having to go to LabCorp or another place.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Hurst, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The process took too long.  There was a phone interview followed by an interview with the hiring manager followed by a peer interview by 10 peers in a conference room where they asked ridiculous questions centered around "tolerance" with regard to race/religion.
Interview Questions: Name a time in your career where you were a member of a team who were a different race, religion, or political party than you and how you handled that.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Completed an online application through Indeed.  Received a phone call from HR to schedule an interview. Met with the Director for the interview, which took about an hour. The interviewer showed me around the office and explained the job in great detail.  I am very qualified for the job since it is in the Medical Staff Office.  All that she described to me about the job I have at least 3 years worth of experience.
Interview Questions: Q:  Tell me about yourself.

title: Food Service Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Bedford, TX) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with Manager/Chef brief description of job, duties, and responsibilities. Brief tour of area and kitchen supply areas.  I do not feel that the true expectation of responsibilities were expressed.  In my evaluation after first two weeks the workload would be more distributed among two candidates.  Job should be split between an Inventory officer/buyer and a Stock/Material handler.  This was not completely expressed to full extent of the actual workload by that job title - Food Service Buyer.
Interview Questions: Are you ok with numerous interruption, and physical lifting of supplies, as well as inventory control.

title: PAR II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: My interview was great. I felt a familiarity with the interviewer even though we just met. I knew this would be a great company to work for. I was referred by a staffing agency and then was sent over for an interview very quickly. The company was growing and they had positions to fill.
Interview Questions: What obstacles have you faced in this industry?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was super easy and laid back. The manager on my unit asked me about nursing school and what my end goal was for nursing and how working on the unit may affect that. Then we talked about the logistics of the job and was offered the job at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back interview. Not too many questions. Great experience. Hiring manager was on vacation so it took longer than normal. Interviewer was easy to talk to and it wasn't super serious.
Interview Questions: Why you over the 10 other applicants?

title: Clinical Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received an email questionnaire a week after applying. Manager called to schedule a face to face interview. Interviewed with the manager and director basic behavior interview questions. Two days later received an email requesting references.  Three days later recieved email that I wasn't selected.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a disagreement with a co worker...

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and a recruiter had me full of an application.  After that, I did a phone interview with the hiring manager which went well.   Then they asked meet to do an in person interview and the salary range was discussed.   Well I lived 14 hours away by car and they weren't able to pay for my airfare down there.   I didn't even need a hotel since I had somewhere to stay locally.  I ended up paying my own way down there and the interview itself went really good.   I thought they were going to hire me.   However two weeks later I hadn't heard either way about the position.  When I contacted the hiring manager, I found out that they had cancelled the job altogether.   This would have been fine if they didn't have new eating my time and money going down there while I was unemployed.  I don't mind not getting a job I interview for.   But in this scenario, I didn't have a chance.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this company?

title: Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was about 30 minutes, interviewer asked about my job experience. I was called the next day that I was accepted for the position. The interview was short with one other employee who would help manage the team. The process wasn't as formal as most interviews I have been a part of.
Interview Questions: About previous experience with billing, medical records

title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter and hiring manager were wonderful! I submitted my application online. Got a call from the recruiter after 2 days. Scheduled interview with the hiring manager 5 days after and was offered the job within the day of the interview.
Interview Questions: Before becoming a nurse, what would you say was your best accomplishment?

title: Department Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It takes a while for a recruiter to get back to you, but after than the process was pretty straight forward. They invite you to the campus to do an in-person interview and ask you typical questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Non-clinical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Great and smooth process. Recruiters and hiring managers were a joy to work with. Always responded to my emails within a day, with helpful information. Took about two weeks from start to finish (submission of application to job offer). Began with a phone questionnaire, then an interview with the hiring manager, as well as a peer interview. I enjoyed the entire process! Took a few steps, but great things come with work!
Interview Questions: What was the hardest task you were given at your previous employer?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty relaxed. Managers were funny and made me feel very comfortable. It was really easy questions. I had the manager and supervisor interviewing me. It does take a long time for the process
Interview Questions: Most recent bad day at work

title: Trauma Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online a week after the contacted me via phone to set up an interview for couple days after. Before the interview they give you a mini test with about 10 questions which I was not prepared for. Mostly the anatomy of the body. Interviewed with two people they asked very easy questions one of them was really friendly and nice the other didn't seem interested at all. When I left I was told I would hear back within the next couple of days.
Interview Questions:
Why did you apply for this Position?
How do you handle many task at the same time?

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Allen, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was only ever contacted by email for interview and request for more information. I was contacted by email by a recruiter and supervisor. The recruiter wanted me to answer specific questions about availability and goals. I responded right away and was told the recruiter  could not open the attachment. This proceeded for approximately one week, and I was then contacted by the supervisor, requesting an interview.
Interview Questions: Was asked by interviewer, to elaborate on my experience

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I was contacted the next day for a phone screening and then invited to an interview a week later. The phone screen was easy and relaxed and so was the interview
Interview Questions: why do you want to work as a PCT, and why THR?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The timeframe was normal for an individual contributor. It took about 2 months from the time I applied until an offer was presented. Once presented with the offer I was allowed to provide previous employer a 30 day notice.
Interview Questions: Why are you a great candidate for this role

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Asked strengths and how you would handle work related issues with coworkers or situations. Stressed mission and values of the company. I feel they are looking for a friendly, approachable personality.
Interview Questions: How did you resolve a conflict with another employee and what did you do or say?

title: MLS Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was greeted by a supervisor and taken to who I believe was the lab manager's office. A bench tech joined the interview and we got started from there. We had some small talk before starting the interview. The interview started with more technical situations having to do with the specific department and from there switched to more interaction based questions.
Interview Questions: What is your 5 year plan?

title: Admissions Specialist-Call Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied on 09/14 through the online application, received an email from HR stating they would be forwarding my application over to the hiring manager and to also fill out a pre-screen document and email it back. Received a call from the hiring manager on 09/21 to schedule an interview. Scheduled interview for 09/27 with the hiring manager and another manager. I received an email while awaiting to see if I would receive an offer , to provide 5 references. Two must have been current and/or former supervisors and the other 3 could be co-workers (current and former) or more supervisors but could not be any friends/family. All references must be professional. Received a call from HR on 10/12 with an offer and scheduled start date of 10/31. Have to do several sets of medical test surveys and paper work and also get a flu shot if haven't already had one.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Bedford, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: A portion of the interview was with the lab manager and supervisor. They asked general behavior questions about communication, strengths, weaknesses, etc. Then we had a tour of the lab. Then had a peer interview which included a panel of current employees that ask you more behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What was a business decision you made in the last year, and what were the factors that you helped you make your decision?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I went thru a temp agency and worked for 8 months then was offered the position. Once I was hired I had to go to orientation for 3 days and I had to do a background check and drug test.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience? Are you licensed and if I call your previous employer what will they say about you? What did you do when a patient was irate or out of control?

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Flower Mound, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-line using the THR Flower Mound website and was called by the hiring manager for an in person interview a few weeks later.  The process was easy and the instructions were clear.  Any questions I had were answered by either the hiring manager or human resources.  I don't have any complaints.  Everyone was friendly.
Interview Questions: general questions about my prior work expierience

title: Insurance Verification Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Grand Prairie, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Very motivating! I went through an agency. The initial description of the job was vague... (usually the case when dealing with agencies) However I was excited upon speaking with the interviewer. It was a wonderful experience and I am happy to say they do protect their clients by doing a thorough background check and investigation of employees.. (atlas in my experience).
Interview Questions:
Explain experience.
Company goals
availability

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Easy and fast. E-mail contact, and phone interview first. Then attended actual interview. Easy quick and well thought out. Staff was friendly and welcoming. The entire process was a good experience.

title: Professional Non-Clinical Interview

Interview Descriptions: The panel interview was pleasant and fairly uneventful. The following interview with the manager, who was much younger than I, proved to be a problem. Manager was distracted and yawned twice.
Interview Questions: In business, sometimes, we have to stretch the truth. Tell me about a time when you had to do that.

title: Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Jul 2016

Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online in THR website, received call from GN residency recruiter, scheduled interview with manager/supervisor.  Heard back from recruiter a week after interview. Overall, it was a good experience.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
What is you biggest strength/weakness?
What did you do in your last job?
Where do you see yourself in five years?
Which clinical was your most/least favorite? 
What do you like to do for fun?
What shift can you work?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Cleburne, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process took 2 months. During my interview, it was really laid back. Asked all the normal questions, like why I wanted to work there, tell me about yourself, etc.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work for them?

title: Patient Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: You will meet with HR rep who describe the company and its mission, then will meet with a supervisor who describes the job and what that it entails.  They will also ask yu about your background, if you have any experience in healthcare or not, what are your goals for the future, ete, ete.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with difficult patients?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources

title: Admissions Specialist-PRN As Needed- THR HEB Hospital Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Bedford, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Received email regarding online application acceptance. Received email that application would be forward to manager. Received email from hiring manager of time and date for phone step 1 interview. Advised if excepted for next interview, would receive call or email. Advised job pays base of $15.50 with no benefits.  Pay non negotiable. On call basically for work. No set schedule. No set days off. Advised paid training. Classroom and training on floor. Business clothing for training. Uniform for work position. Possibility of upgrade to part time as needed to permanent position. Interview on phone average. Manager very nice. Waiting for follow up call or email if I am to move forward in the interview process. Very positive.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview was very short and easy. We had a one on one visit and went over what the job is about. After a couple of weeks of not response I had to call back to see if I was selected for the job.

title: Graduate Nurse Interview

Where do you see yourself in 5-10 years?

title: Registered Diagnostic Medical Sonographer Interview

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Admissions Specialist Interview

title: Patient Care Technician Interview

Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Navigator Interview

title: CSO Interview

title: Admissions Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interview was a breeze! The recruiting process is the dragging part, it seems as if they have things confused or mixed up at times. But once you actually get the chance to interview with the hospital things seem much smoother dealing with the hiring managers instead.

Interview Descriptions: Sat one on one with hiring manager, discussed my qualifications and experience in a leadership role and provided examples of why I thought I would be a good fit for this position, went through behavioral type questions, then discussed what the position would consist of, asked what i preferred for salary, discussed second interview

title: Admissions Interview

title: Janitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: screening interview is a type of job interview that is conducted to determine if the applicant has the qualifications needed to do the job for which the company is hiring. A screening interview is typically the first interview in the hiring process if the company does not start with open interviews.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What are your strengths?
What are your weaknesses?
Why do you want this job?
Where would you like to be in your career five years from now?
What's your ideal company?
What attracted you to this company?
Why should we hire you?
What did you like least about your last job?
When were you most satisfied in your job?
What can you do for us that other candidates can't? 
What were the responsibilities of your last position?  
Why are you leaving your present job?
What do you know about this industry?  
What do you know about our company? 
Are you willing to relocate?  
Do you have any questions for me?

title: Applications Analyst Interview

title: Clinical Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions:
Initial communication (and most communication throughout the interview process) consisted of an email from the HR department asking me to call to answer questions or to schedule interviews. Most of the time my return call went to voice mail and we played phone tag. Communication from the hiring manager always came through this same person in HR, further complicating the interview process. 

I was warned that the hiring process was "cumbersome" and would require multiple interviews (phone, Skype, etc.) prior to a face-to-face interview, thus I wasn't expecting the process to be complete and an offer within a few weeks. However, following 2 1/2 months of emails, phone calls, voice mail messages, etc. I saw the writing on the wall - I can't work in an environment that "communicates" like this! 

I withdrew my application.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward process. Online applications only, one interview. Contacted for interview about a week after applying and offered position later the same day via recruiter over the phone.  Depending on department, possible to have more than one interviewer, including department peers.  Almost hospital standard to use B.E.I. (Behavioral Event Interview) questions..."Tell me about a time are situation..."
Interview Questions:
List of typical BEI questions:

Tell me about a time when you had to use your persuasion skills to convince someone to see things your way

Tell me about a time when you had to go above and beyond the call of duty in order to get a job done

Describe a time when you were faced with a stressful situation that demonstrated your coping skills

Give me an example of a time when you showed initiative in your job.

Tell me an example of a time when you had to deal with an upset customer or co-worker.

Give me an example of a time when you had to use your fact-finding skills to solve a problem

Describe a time that you anticipated potential problems and developed preventative measures

Tell me about a time when you used good judgment and logic in solving a problem

Describe a time when you had to adapt to a wide variety of people

title: Population Health Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions:
After applying for the position, I went online (constantly) to check if my application had been forwarded or any progress made. After about two weeks, the hiring manager called me to schedule an interview. I was so excited because I'd been applying for various jobs since February of 2013. Finally an interview! So, my husband and I move to Dallas, get settled and I prepare for the interview. I had an amazing experience in interviewing with the manager. She was kind and very easy to talk to. She even walked me to my car!

Fast forward two weeks -- no news. Two more weeks, nothing. After racking my brain, I decided to call her and I did. She basically informed me that the company wasn't looking for any more Population Health navigators and that the ones she'd already hired were going to be the only ones for the time being. She seemed very confused to why HR/Recruiters hadn't conveyed the message to me, but told me to apply for some of the other navigator positions open. I told her that I appreciated her and that I would.

Fast forward to today, and I notice that the job has been re-posted! Naturally, I felt like it was my chance again to get hired. I sent the woman I interviewed with a quick e-mail expressing my interest in the position along with an updated resume and letter of reference. I looked at my job status online again and it says, "Not selected for interview". Interesting, seeing as how I DID have an interview.

I'm not sure if the departments actually communicate with one another. 

Other than the obvious confusion, my interview was pleasant and I still recommend applying with THR.
Interview Questions: Nothing too difficult or scary. Just be professional and be yourself. They obviously like you if you've scored an interview.

title: Programmer Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas Health Resources
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my resume, I was contacted by HR who informed me there will be a career fair in town and asked me to stop by for an initial interview.  I was then contacted by HR for a panel interview at THR.  The panel interview consisted of 4 programmers for the first round of interviews and then 2 managers for the second round of interview.  I was then contacted by HR, offering me the job.
Interview Questions: At times, you will have to work with an irate customer.  How would you handle your communication with this customer to calm him/her down?

title: Director Medical Imaging Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Denton, TX) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Recruiter Phone call
VP - phone call
In house interview 2 day

Interviewer was great.  The VP at the time was great as well.  The group interview was comfortable, challenging and insightful as to what I could look forward too. Had no contact with upper management which would have been good.
Interview Questions: Team building

title: Corporate Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: the hiring process takes a long time. The manager have to continually reach out to human resources regarding the status of new  employees. Once hr gets things rolling it doesn't take long at that point
Interview Questions: I don't rememeber the questions they asked  this was  a while ago. Just be be ready  for panel interview questions.  they will ask you to give an example with every question they ask you.

title: PT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Just a standard sit down and answer questions. Read questions off of a list. Very general about why you want to be in the industry, what your background is, and what you expect out of the job.
Interview Questions: Why are you passionate about health?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a smooth process. I interviewed with a secondary supervisory due to the original being called to another meeting. She asked me a few questions regarding my experience but mainly informed me on the many details and aspects of the job.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when I experienced conflict while at work and how did I handle it?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by an agency -- 2 days later interviewed PMO Manager by phone.  Standard phone interview 30 mins -- tell about yourself, type of projects managed, and also was asked to talk about a project managed that bombed and what I did to recover it or from it.
Interview Questions: In person interview -- meet with 2 PMO Managers -- it was sort of good cop/bad cop.  Good cop greeted me at reception took me to a conference room and just had a interview conversation with me.  The "bad cop" walked in "no knock" and introduced himself as the one who interviewed me by phone.  He asked 2 tough questions in an adversarial tone.

title: Hospitalist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: walk and talk interview.  Met with director and went over the program and schedule while meeting some of the staff.  It was low pressure and more of orientation like process.  I was offered  the job at the completion of the interview.
Interview Questions: more of a tour than interview

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Data base centralized application. Contacted by recruiter for interview.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself in one word.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed with HR, and then interviewed with my future bosses.  It took a while from initial contact until the job offer, almost 2 months.
Once they finally offered me a position, it went quickly,  orientation, etc.
Interview Questions: What is you biggest asset?

title: Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews. First I met with the manager, she went to over some stuff. Ask a few question about my previous job. My second interview was with all the services supervisors. They ask general question about the OR like what you should do in case certain things happened. The interview questions were pretty easy.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here?
What do you do when a Surgeon makes mistake?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Apply online. Screened by Human Resources and application sent to department manager. I received a call from the manager and an agreed upon time to meet for interview was decided.  Day of interview, I felt lost upon entering the hospital and directions of where to go. My anxiety level was elevated due to lack of directions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: PBX Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Denton, TX) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Contribute an online application and wait for a call from an offsite human resources specialist to call and schedule an interview with the onsite patient access manager. Have one interview with the manager and then the hiring decision is made within a few days.
Interview Questions: Answer the phone like you would be answering the hospital phone, and be professional.

title: Center Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview was courteous and friendly.  Actual face to face interview was not as courteous and friendly.  Appeared to be more of a fact finding interview about my previous employer. Office staff appeared happy and satisfied.  No real feel for the work culture.
Interview Questions: How did I get my previous position?

title: Billing Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Dallas, TX) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: it was easy, the person that interviewed me 8 years ago, is no longer with the company, but she was very easy going, and made me feel very comfortable, easy going, it was just a lucky day for me, the person that interviewed me, had applied for a higher position, that she got the position, and offered me the position that I had originally applied for with at the time was in the Call Center for Patient Services.
Interview Questions: how long had i been working in the medical field.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant.  Recruiter was very nice and postive.  Enjoyed the entire process.  Interviewed with all the people in my department.   They were all very nice.   It really was great for me.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions thrown at me.  Was a straight forward interview process, with only applicable questions asked.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: My experience was a telephone interview that lasted 15 minutes. I was working thru Sunbelt Staffing for nurses out of Baco Raton FL. The walk thru and in person interview was the first day that I came for orientation. This is a rare occurrence I am sure, but this was my experience.
Interview Questions: The manager asked about my experiences and my goals for the future. He wanted to know how I would be an asset to the team.

title: Medical Lab Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Bedford, TX) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: They now do peer interviews. Be expected to sit with the Lab Director and a few of the employees you will be working with to answer questions from each individual.
Interview Questions: Questions are basic behavior based questions.

title: Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Fort Worth, TX) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for a full time 3rd shift position as a Patient Care Tech for Harris Hospital Ft. Worth.  The first interview was during the day with the Nurse Manager. She was very friendly and introduced me to everyone on that shift. She told me she would call me back to interview with the night shift supervisor another day. She called as promised. I interviewed with the night shift supervisor as well as other staff I would be working with. Everyone seemed friendly, helpful, and down to earth. I did not get the position. The nurse manager emailed me informing me she went with a different applicant. She was very prompt and polite, and it was a great interview process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself...

title: Lease Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions:
1) Phone interview with HR -  basic, personality test given
2). 2nd interview with Director of Department - easy flow, ask about your experience, discuss the position
3). Interviewed with 2 current employees - it was more of a personality testing.
4)  Took a while 3 weeks before I received an offer for the position
Interview Questions: No difficult or unexpected questions - Waiting was the most difficult.

title: Principal Trainer - EHR Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: There are 2 interviews to get hired on the team. The first one is a phone interview with Human Resources. They ask general questions to determine if you are a suitable candidate. The second interview is with the team. There are at least 6 people that will question you using questions that helps them determine if you have the skills necessary to perform the job and whether you are able to get along with the team members.
Interview Questions: How would I handle an angry physician?

title: Director IT Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas Health Resources (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Typical first round with recruiter followed up by an online assessment with some simple math questions. Next round was a panel interview and it was in person with several senior management representatives. Final was a presentation to a large audience.
Interview Questions: Typical situational's and review of resume.
